item.title: Algebraic Datatypes
item.description: Algebraic Datatypes # Algebraic datatypes are a combination of sum types and product types which we discuss next. Sum types # Sum types are used to represent different variants of values. They are also called variant types or tagged union types. A simple example of a sum type would be a type where corresponding values are limited to one of the three base colors: red, green, and blue.

item.title: Pattern Matching
item.description: Pattern Matching # Pattern matching provides a way to inspect algebraic datatypes and access the components of their variants. Matching for enum types # The following pseudo code describes the behavior of a function asHexString which computes a hexadecimal representation of a BaseColor value. asHexString(RED) -> "#ff0000" asHexString(GREEN) -> "#00ff00" asHexString(BLUE) -> "#0000ff" BaseColor was defined as an enum type, so we can use a switch statement to implement an asHexString method.
